member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.GlobalParameters
member.summary:
Contains global parameters for LINE2D template matching.
Values that are defined work well in majority of situations (but can be changed if an user wants to - recompilation).

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.GlobalParameters.NUM_OF_QUNATIZED_ORIENTATIONS
member.summary:
Number of quantized orientations. Needed for feature extraction.
Maximum value is 8 (number of bits in byte). 3rd i 4th quadrant are mapped to 2nd and 1st
Although this number can be lower than 8 precision can be lost, but the preprocessing stage can be speeded-up (lower number of response maps).

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.GlobalParameters.MAX_FEATURE_SIMILARITY
member.summary: Max feature similarity. Default value is 4. Needed for feature (template) comparison. This constant can be interpreted as max angle similarity.

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.GlobalParameters.MAX_NUM_OF_FEATURES
member.summary: Max number of features per template. It can be used for template feature extraction.

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.GlobalParameters.MAX_SUPPORTED_NUM_OF_FEATURES_ADDDED_AS_BYTE
member.summary: Max number of features that can be added to a buffer of type .

member.summary: Creates linearized maps pyramid.

member.summary:
Linearized memory maps calculation.

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.LinearizedMaps.MAP_STRIDE_ALLIGNMENT
member.summary:
Linear map stride alignment.
It's value is 0 because linear map should be represented as continuous vector (without stride alignment).

member.summary:
Pre-calculated similarities between feature angle (binary representations) and all angle combinations.
[NUM_OF_ORIENTATIONS, 256 (all possible angle combinations for an source orientation)]

member.summary: Creates linear response maps.

member.param: Corresponding position in the linearized map.

member.summary: Gets linear maps. The map is selected according to an angle and then to an neighborhood.

member.name: P:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.LinearizedMaps.NeigborhoodSize
member.summary: Gets neigborhood size which is used to caclulate spreaded orientation image (FeatureMap)

member.name: P:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.LinearizedMaps.ImageSize
member.summary: Gets original image size from which the response map is caclulated.

member.name: P:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.LinearizedMaps.ImageValidSize
member.summary:
Getsvalid image size.
Valid size is: (imgWidth / neigborhood * neigborhood, imgWidth / neigborhood * neigborhood) - integer divisions are used.

member.name: P:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.LinearizedMaps.LinearMapSize
member.summary:
Gets linear map size.
Linear size is: (imgWidth / neigborhood, imgHeight / neigborhood) - integer divisions are used.

member.name: T:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.FeatureMap
member.summary:
Orientation feature map.
Feature map creation has 3 stages:
1) Orientation quantization: [0..360] => [0..NUM_OF_QUNATIZED_ORIENTATIONS].
2) Filtering quantized orientations (neighborhood must be the same oriented) and representing them in a binary form: [0..NUM_OF_QUNATIZED_ORIENTATIONS] => [1, 2, 4, 8, 16...]
3) Spreading binary represented orientations to local neighborhood. This is a trade-off between accuracy and the noise resistance.

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.FeatureMap.INVALID_ORIENTATION
member.summary: Marker for invalid orientation (magnitude too small)

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.FeatureMap.INVALID_QUANTIZED_ORIENTATION
member.summary: Marker for invalid quantized orientation (magnitude too small)

member.name: F:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.FeatureMap.AngleQuantizationTable
member.summary:
Angle quantization lookup table. It transforms [0..360] => [0..NUM_OF_QUNATIZED_ORIENTATIONS-1].
For input value INVALID_ORIENTATION INVALID_QUANTIZED_ORIENTATION will be returned. This special value is needed during feature map building to discard pixels which have small magnitude.

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.FeatureMap.RetainImportantQuantizedOrientations(Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Gray{System.Byte}[0:,0:],System.Int32)
member.summary: Take only those orientations that have MINIMAL_NUM_OF_SAME_ORIENTED_PIXELS in 3x3 negborhood. Performs angle transformation into binary form ([0..7] -> [1, 2, 4, 8, ..., 128]) as well.
member.param: Quantized orientation image where angles are represented by lables [0..GlobalParameters.NUM_OF_QUNATIZED_ORIENTATIONS] (invalid orientation label included).
Minimal number of same orientations for 3x3 neigborhood. The range is: [0..9] (3x3 neigborhood).

member.name: M:Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Algorithms.LINE2D.FeatureMap.Calculate(Accord.Extensions.Imaging.Gray{System.Int32}[0:,0:],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates features map. First orientations are quantized, the stable ones are selected and then they are spread.
member.param: Orientation map. Each location represents angle in degrees [0..360].
Spreading neighborhood. If 1 no spreading is done.
Minimal number of the same orientations in [3 x 3] neighborhood to proclaim the orientation stable.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.MaxBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1})
member.summary: Returns the maximal element of the given sequence, based on the given projection.
member.remarks: If more than one element has the maximal projected value, the first one encountered will be returned. This overload uses the default comparer for the projected type. This operator uses immediate execution, but only buffers a single result (the current maximal element).
member.param: Selector to use to pick the results to compare
member.returns: The maximal element, according to the projection.

member.name: M:MoreLinq.MoreEnumerable.MaxBy``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{``1})
member.summary: Returns the maximal element of the given sequence, based on the given projection and the specified comparer for projected values.
member.remarks: If more than one element has the maximal projected value, the first one encountered will be returned. This overload uses the default comparer for the projected type. This operator uses immediate execution, but only buffers a single result (the current maximal element).
member.param: Selector to use to pick the results to compare
Comparer to use to compare projected values
member.returns: The maximal element, according to the projection.
